summary: This document is an email chain from November 2020 between a U.S. Attorney's office (likely SDNY) and the Office of the Deputy Attorney General (ODAG). It discusses scheduling a meeting to review cases that could attract media attention, mentions an investigation filed under seal (UR), and references planning for the post-election transition period.

persons.name: DAG
persons.context: The DAG wants to set up meetings with key U.S. Attorneys to discuss the Department's work during the transition period (November to January and beyond).

events.title: Scheduled SDNY Discussion
events.description: A meeting/SVTC (Secure Video Teleconference) is scheduled for 3:00 PM to discuss cases that could attract media attention and the Department's work during the transition period.

keyFacts: The email discusses preparing for a meeting to review cases that could attract media attention in the coming months.
It references an investigation that was filed under seal (UR) and inquires about any significant actions anticipated on it.
The correspondence is set in the context of the November 2020 election and planning for a transition period within the Department of Justice.
The sender from the U.S. Attorney's office is awaiting COVID-19 test results and is working from home in Brooklyn.
